are you using Gnome or KDE
there is no specific command sent by Ctrl+Alt+Backspace, but you can get the same effect by switching to another terminal, logging in, and giving the command 'sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart'
You can have a script to restart X, simply have it give the command '/etc/init.d/gdm restart' and run it with sudo
the problem is that it doesnt actually
probably because the command is run within the context of Gnome, which is killed on restart, which means the restart command is killed by restarting
Ctrl+Alt+Backspace will do the trick
